definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: You can tell the very rich by their evening dress.
sentences.chinese: 你可从夜礼服认出那些极有钱的富人。

sentences.english: He has a distinctive goatee, so I can recognize him easily.
sentences.chinese: 他留着独特的山羊胡子，所以我很容易就认出他来了。

sentences.english: It shows real people, regardless of who can recognize them.
sentences.chinese: 不管谁能认出他们，真实的人物出现在里面。

sentences.english: I recognized him as soon as I saw his back.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到后身，就认出是他。

sentences.english: Li recognized the voice of her boss.
sentences.chinese: 李万枝认出是工厂领导的声音。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the butcher recognized the dog as belonging to a neighbor of his.
sentences.chinese: 很幸运地，肉商辨认出’这只狗是属于他邻居的。

sentences.english: Why is the man in black the thief?
sentences.chinese: 你知道包大人是如何辨认出小偷的吗？

sentences.english: Monkey, seeing that the boy was actually a demon in disguise, told his master not to bother.
sentences.chinese: 悟空认出那是妖怪变的，叫师父少管闲事。

sentences.english: The face there, if you have seen him before, you will recognize as Yeats's.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，如果你见过他，你会认出这是叶芝。

sentences.english: I knew him for a Frenchman.
sentences.chinese: 我认出他是一名法国人。

sentences.english: He discerned that Howard was lying.
Peering out his door into the night, he recognized the face of a trusted neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 他开门窥望，夜色中认出是一位可靠的邻居。
现在谁还能认出他来呢？

sentences.english: Her mind seemed to be wandering, and she didn't recognize me.
sentences.chinese: 她好象精神恍惚，没认出我来。

sentences.english: The porters may be identified by their red caps.
sentences.chinese: 从他们戴的红帽子就可以辨认出他们是行李搬运工。

definition: to recognize/to remember sth (or sb) on seeing it/to know
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
